words.definition: A brick is a hard block used for building.
words.example: The house was made of red bricks.

words.definition: To crumble means to break into small pieces.
words.example: The old wall was starting to crumble.

words.definition: Dough is a mixture of flour and water used for baking.
words.example: I used the dough to make some bread.

words.definition: To express means to show what you think or feel.
words.example: She expressed her happiness with a big smile.

words.definition: A fist is a hand with the fingers closed tightly.
words.example: He held the money tightly in his fist.

words.definition: If something is flexible, it can bend easily.
words.example: Rubber is a very flexible material.

words.definition: To flush means to become red in the face.
words.example: She flushed with embarrassment.

words.definition: To injure someone means to hurt them.
words.example: He injured his leg while playing soccer.

words.definition: A lump is a small piece of something with no definite shape.
words.example: There was a lump of sugar in my tea.

words.definition: A mixture is a combination of different things.
words.example: The cake mixture was very sweet.

words.definition: To reconcile means to become friends again after an argument.
words.example: The two friends reconciled after their fight.

words.definition: To ruin something means to spoil or destroy it.
words.example: The rain ruined our picnic.

words.definition: To shatter means to break into many small pieces.
words.example: The glass shattered when it hit the floor.

words.definition: Shutters are wooden covers on the outside of a window.
words.example: We closed the shutters when the storm began.

words.definition: To sift means to put a substance through a sieve.
words.example: Sift the flour before you add it to the bowl.

words.definition: If something is slight, it is small in amount or degree.
words.example: There was a slight change in the schedule.

words.definition: To sparkle means to shine with small flashes of light.
words.example: The diamond sparkled in the light.

words.definition: To sprinkle means to scatter small drops or pieces over something.
words.example: Sprinkle some salt on the popcorn.

words.definition: If food is stale, it is no longer fresh.
words.example: The bread was stale, so I threw it away.

words.definition: To utter means to say something.
words.example: He didn't utter a word during the meeting.
